intro: Impatiens vaniotiana, commonly known as the Vaniot's impatiens, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Balsaminaceae and is characterized by its striking, spurred flowers that come in a variety of vibrant colors. The plant typically grows as an upright herb with opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and greenhouses around the world.
